SENT.plain: We report a case of cerebral lipiodol embolism following transcatheter chemoembolization (TACE) for hepatocellular carcinoma
A 70-year-old woman with a large unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma underwent TACE
Her level of consciousness deteriorated after the procedure, and magnetic resonance imaging and non-contrast computed tomography revealed a cerebral lipiodol embolism
Despite intensive care, the patient died 2 weeks later
The complication might have been due to systemic-pulmonary shunts caused by previous surgeries and/or direct invasion of the recurrent tumor
